title: How to Identify a Golden Retriever

steps.title: View the size of the dog.
steps.content: View the size of the dog. Golden Retrievers are medium-sized dogs. Males are 23–24 inches (58–61 cm) tall, weighing 65–75 pounds (29–34 kg), while females are 21.5–22.5 inches (55–57 cm) tall and weigh 55–65 pounds (25–29 kg). [2] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source

steps.title: Check the ears.
steps.content: Check the ears. Golden Retrievers have rather short ears. The front edges are attached behind and just above the eyes. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source The tips fall close to the dog's cheeks and, if pulled over, should cover the eyes. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source

steps.title: Look at the eyes.
steps.content: Look at the eyes. A Golden Retriever's eyes are medium-large, and they can be either medium or dark brown with dark eye rims. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source They give the dog an intelligent, friendly expression.

steps.title: See the dog's tail.
steps.content: See the dog's tail. The tail of a Golden Retriever is thick and muscular at the base. It is carried level or moderately curved upward, though never curled or between the legs. [6] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source

steps.title: Inspect the overall body structure.
steps.content: Inspect the overall body structure. Golden Retrievers have a muscular build with a strong back and straight legs. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source Their bodies are described as being symmetrical and well balanced, and they have a smooth, free gait. [8] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source

steps.title: Look for a dense, water-repellent coat.
steps.content: Look for a dense, water-repellent coat. Golden Retrievers have firm and resilient outer coats and good undercoats. [9] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source Their glossy coats can be either straight or wavy. [10] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source

steps.title: See if the coat is a golden shade.
steps.content: See if the coat is a golden shade. Golden Retrievers are named for their golden coats. Their coats are a "rich, lustrous golden of various shades", [11] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source which can range from a light cream color to a deep reddish gold.

steps.title: Identify feathering.
steps.content: Identify feathering. Like some other breeds, Golden Retrievers are seen with feathering. Feathering is defined as a "longer fringe of hair on ears, legs, tail, or body". [12] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source This feathering, which appears on a Golden Retriever's legs, tail, neck, and underbody, may be lighter than the rest of the coat. [13] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source

steps.title: See how active the dog is.
steps.content: See how active the dog is. Golden Retrievers have high energy levels and are active and athletic. These retrievers need regular exercise to stay satisfied. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Notice loyalty.
steps.content: Notice loyalty. Golden Retrievers can develop deep bonds with their owners. [15] X Research source They demonstrate loyalty to those they spend the most time with and may feel anxious when they're alone.

steps.title: Pay attention to how entertained the dog is.
steps.content: Pay attention to how entertained the dog is. If they're not occupied, Golden Retrievers can easily become bored. It is important that they have things to do to prevent this. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Look for a trustworthy personality.
steps.content: Look for a trustworthy personality. Golden Retrievers are reliable dogs. With proper socialization, this trait allows them to make great family pets, and they can be trusted around children with supervision. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Check for adaptability.
steps.content: Check for adaptability. Some breeds don't do well with other pets, but Golden Retrievers are typically adaptable. Many Golden Retrievers can live peacefully with other animals, such as cats. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Tell how Golden Retrievers and Chesapeake Bay Retrievers differ.
steps.content: Tell how Golden Retrievers and Chesapeake Bay Retrievers differ. The Chesapeake Bay Retriever, also referred to as a Chessie, is a retrieving breed from the Mid-Atlantic. [21] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source One noticeable difference between the breeds is that Chessies have wavy fur that is dense, thick, and short. [22] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source A Chessie's coat is brown, resembling nature to blend in, though one may have minimal white markings on the feet or stomach. [23] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source They are brave, love water, and are willing to work.

steps.title: Recognize the differences between Golden Retrievers and Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retrievers.
steps.content: Recognize the differences between Golden Retrievers and Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retrievers . The Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever, also called a Toller, is a retriever of unknown breeding origin, but it was bred to hunt ducks. [24] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Tollers are smaller than Goldens, being the smallest of the retriever breeds. [25] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Tollers are quick, alert, and determined, and they may even have a slightly worried or sad expression when they aren't working. steps.title: Understand how Golden Retrievers and Flat-Coated Retrievers differ.
steps.content: Understand how Golden Retrievers and Flat-Coated Retrievers differ. Flat-Coated Retrievers are also called Flat-Coats and were bred in the mid-1800s. [28] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source They are fairly similar in size to Goldens but have long, flat muzzles. [29] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source Flat-Coats have straight, flat-lying coats that can be either solid black or solid liver. [30] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source They are sensible, alert, and cheerful.

steps.title: Distinguish between Golden Retrievers and Curly-Coated Retrievers.
steps.content: Distinguish between Golden Retrievers and Curly-Coated Retrievers . Curly-Coated Retrievers, or Curlies, are among the oldest of the retrievers. [32] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Curlies are larger than Goldens, weighing as much as 60–95 pounds (27–43 kg). The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source They have unique wedge-shaped heads, and, as their name suggests, coats consisting of short, tight curls, which come in solid black and solid liver. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Curlies are gentle, affectionate, and more independent than Goldens.

steps.title: Spot differences between Golden Retrievers and Labrador Retrievers.
steps.content: Spot differences between Golden Retrievers and Labrador Retrievers . The Labrador Retriever, or Lab, is another popular retrieving breed. Labs are roughly the same size as Goldens, though they have a larger scale height- and weight-wise. [35] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Labs can be seen in colors other than gold - their coats can be solid yellow, brown, or black.
